text: It's Jeff Barr here at AWS in Seattle.

Here's a couple of launches 
that caught my eye this week.

You can now access your Amazon EC2
 reserved instance purchase recommendations
to the AWS cost explorer API.

These recommendations are 
calculated based on your past usage
and highlight possible cost savings.

You can adjust the reserved instance’s
 parameters and historical timeframe
to customize your recommendations.

Lambda@Edge enables you to further
 customize the delivery of content stored

in an Amazon S3 bucket by allowing you
 to access additional whitelist of headers,

including custom headers 
within origin facing events.

For example, you can configure amazon cloud
 front to cash and forward a country header

to your S3 origin and then use Lambda@Edge
 to dynamically redirect viewers

to country-specific versions of your website
 based on the viewers location.

The AWS key management service 
provides our customers with assurance

that keys are created and used 
by hardware security modules in KMS,

to meet federal information processing
 standard publication 140-2 requirements.

You could also choose to make
 requests of KMS using API endpoints

that terminate TLS sessions using a phipps
140-2 validated cryptographic software module.

Thanks for joining us this week 
for some of our launch highlights.

For the full slate of recent launches, 
check out her What's New page.

Be sure to like this video and subscribe
 so you won’t miss an update,
and we'll see you next week.

Oh, by the way, we are working on a new set
 of episodes of “This is my architecture,”
and we're gonna launch in the spring.
Oh, hey Matt,
what’s up?

Well, this is embarrassing, 
hey Jeff, how's, it going.
Oh, good.
Thanks for coming by.

How’s things’ going with 
“This is my architecture?”.

Pretty good. We did an exciting shoot 
this week with T-Mobile, Nordstrom, Amazon,
Fresh, Salesforce, some great videos.

Those sound awesome, 
and I cannot wait to see them.
Thanks for stopping by.
Good to see you.

“What’s new?” with Jeff Barr, 
that’s a wrap.
